title: Software Engineer, Semiconductor Manufacturing, Raxium
description: Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another.
key_qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 8 years of experience in software development, and data structures/algorithms. 5 years of experience testing and launching software products, and 3 years with software design/architecture. Experience with C#, C++, Python, WPF, Winforms, Blazor, SQL Server database, Oracle database, T-SQL, PL/SQL, Power BI, GEM/SECS, and tool communication. Experience with ASP.NET and ADO.NET.
preferred_qualifications: Experience developing and maintaining the Manufacturing Execution System (MES) in the semiconductor industry. Experience in UI development, RDBMS table design, and writing SQL queries. Experience with Statistical Process Control (SPC) systems. Experience testing, maintaining, or launching software products. Experience in developing reports and dashboards.
responsibilities: Develop, maintain, administer, and enhance the Manufacturing Execution System (MES), Statistical Process Control (SPC), and engineering software applications. Develop software applications for semiconductor tool data collection. Implement best practices in documenting user requirements, design, coding, and testing of software solutions. Partner with cross-functional teams, leadership, engineers, program managers, and data scientists to understand business and application needs. Work on multiple overlapping projects at the same time and work independently with minimal supervision.
